msContents.summary: The Vasudhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka is a hymn in praise to Vasudhārā, a Buddhist deity of wealth and abundance, composed of one hundred and eight epithets. This hymn is often found in the Saptavāra collection in the place of the Vasudhāradhāraṇī (see, for instance, MS Add.1315 and MS Add.1356). The paper manuscript has a very orderly and well planned layout and seems to belong to a collection consisting of all the items under the shelfmark Or.1814.

msItem.title: Vasudhārānāmāṣṭottaraśataka
Vasundharānāmāṣṭottaraśataka
Vasudhārāṣṭottaraśatanāma
Vasundharāṣṭottaraśatanāma
Vasundharānāmastotraśataka
Vasudhārānāmastotraśataka
msItem.rubric: [1v1] oṃ namo bhagavatyai ā[space left blank for a miniature]||ryyavasudhārāyai || ^
msItem.incipit: [1v2] divyarūpi surūpī ca [space left blank for a miniature] saumyarūpivarapradā¦ [1v3] vasudharī vasudhārī [space left blank for a miniature] ca vasuśrī śrīkarī va[1v4]rā || 1 || dharaṇī [space left blank for a miniature] dhāraṇī dhātā śaraṇaṃ [1v5] bhaktivatsalā || pra[space left blank for a miniature]jñāpāramitādevi pra[2r1]jñā śrībuddhivarddhinī ||
msItem.explicit: [4r3] athavā śīlasampannaḥ saptajātismaro bhavet_ || priyavākṣyā[4r4]ś ca deyas tu rūpavān priyadarśana || viprakṣanti ya kuleṣu ādeyam upajāyate || [4r5] aṃtabhūmīśvaraṃ prāpta praścāt prāptasukhāvatiṃ || ^^^ ||

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 31 akṣaras per line.

Double marginal frame lines in red ink (sometimes one pair thereof). Rubrics are highlithed in red. Ruling. In the middle of 1 verso, a 5.5 cm wide space has been left blank for the insertion of a miniature.

bindingDesc.p: Wood cover, original binding (with floral motives).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
